intro: Lasianthus sithammaratensis, commonly known as the Thai white hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial with palmately lobed leaves. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for horticultural cultivation.
